alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 6:02PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Dolores and northwestern Montezuma Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 602 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles south of Dove Creek, or 31 miles east of Blanding. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Dolores and northwestern Montezuma Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
